DOC.brief_summary: This study will explore the potential value in proper therapeutic decision and clinical outcome prediction by using integrated MR-PET system and advanced MR techniques in patients with colorectal cancer.
DOC.brief_title: Application of MR-PET in Colorectal Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: This research expect that the image techniques and experience in this cancer group may be valuable and helpful for others. With advantage of MR-PET in better soft tissue delineation/functional information and less radiation dose than PET-CT, the ultimate goal in both research and clinical application is to establish new diagnostic standard and management guideline by MR-PET, which can further improve clinical outcome and disease prognosis in patients colorectal cancer.
DOC.criteria: 1. Group 1: Patients with newly diagnosed colorectal cancers 2. Group 2: Patients with suspicious recurrent colorectal cancers 1. Age <20 or >90 years old 2. Contraindication for MRI: claustrophobia or MR noncompatible devices 3. Contraindication for MR contrast medium: severe adverse reaction or impaired renal function (Cre > 2.0) 4. History of other malignancy 5. Prior arthroplasty of hip (may cause artifacts on MRI) 6. Pregnancy
